intro: Lippia aberrans, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional remedies. Lippia aberrans is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and fragrant foliage.
